physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal vital signs; oxygen saturation 96% while breathing oxygen at 1 liter per minute.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Decreased breath sounds, expiratory wheezing, and rhonchi at the base of both lungs. Warm and erythematous right lower leg with 3+ pitting edema.
Left pleural effusion and left basilar opacity obscuring the left hemidiaphragm unchanged from previous study. Bandlike opacity in the right lower lung consistent with subsegmental atelectasis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening patchy consolidation in the left lower lobe; new small right pleural effusion was noted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Persistent loculated left pleural effusion with thickening of the pleura, unchanged from the previous imaging.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent oro-pharyngeal findings suggestive of aspiration. Chest pain that had subsided recurred and was rated at 10 out of 10.
